design_audit.treatment_timing: Staggered adoption of pay transparency legislation across Canadian provinces
design_audit.estimand: ATT of pay transparency on gender wage gap
design_audit.comparison_groups: Provinces without transparency laws (never-treated) and provinces before adoption (not-yet-treated)
design_audit.cohorts: Ontario 1996, Manitoba 1997, British Columbia 2001, Prince Edward Island 2005, Nova Scotia 2008, Newfoundland 2009
design_audit.notes: Treatment is binary: treated=1 if province has transparency law AND individual's peers had salary revealed. Two peer group definitions: Inst-Dept and Inst-Dept-Rank.

claim_object.outcome_concept: Log annual salary rate of university faculty
claim_object.treatment_concept: Exposure to pay transparency legislation (treated: province adopted law AND peer salary revealed)
claim_object.estimand_concept: Effect of pay transparency on gender wage gap (female#treated interaction coefficient)
claim_object.target_population: Canadian university faculty (UCASS data, full-time tenured/tenure-track)

constraints.notes: The baseline spec with individual FE has very few time-varying controls. The cross-sectional spec (Table 4 Col 1) adds experience measures. Controls count ranges from 1 (has_responsibilities) to 3 (has_responsibilities + appoint_inst_numyears + degree_high_numyears).

canonical.notes: Cluster SEs at institution level (~49 clusters), matching Stata cl(inst)

variants.notes: Heteroskedasticity-robust only (no clustering) -- Table 5 Col 4 uses vce(robust) with dept-gender trends
Cluster at province level (~10 clusters) -- very few clusters, but natural treatment variation level

diagnostics_plan.notes: Event study figures (Fig 4, Fig 5) serve as pre-trends checks
